launchpad_s_plus

Class PlaySound

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • launchpad_s_plus.PlaySound
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PlaySound
extends java.lang.Thread
    Implements a way to play sound samples located in the resources folder. If the sound file is not found, or of invalid format, a default short Metronome sound will play instead
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Helion

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlaySound

        public PlaySound(java.lang.String name,
                 int vol,
                 boolean playOrStop)
        Constructor. Takes in the name of the file, volume (from 0 to 127) and checks whether the sound should be played or stopped
        Parameters:
        name - File name
        vol - Velocity to play the sound at. Range: 0 to 127, 127 being loudest
        playOrStop - True if the file should be played, false otherwise

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the file to play
        Returns:
        Full path of the file to play

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Gain converted value

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String file,
                      int velocity)
        Plays the sound located at the filepath given with the given velocity level
        Parameters:
        file - Full path of the sound to play
        velocity - MIDI-Based velocity level (0 to 127. 127 being loudest)
